content.rendered:
Effective Date: October 1st, 2025

At TheProtectionGuru.com, we respect your privacy and are committed to protecting the personal information you share with us. This Privacy Policy explains what data we collect, how we use it, and the choices you have regarding your information. By accessing or using our website, you agree to the terms outlined below.

1. Information We Collect

We collect information to provide better services to our users. This may include:

Personal Information: When you voluntarily submit forms, subscribe to our newsletter, or contact us, we may collect your name, email address, phone number, and any other details you provide.

Usage Data: We automatically collect non-identifiable and anonymous information (“non-personal information”) about how you interact with our site, such as your IP address, browser type, operating system, pages visited, and time spent on our site.

2. How We collect your information:

  • Cookies & Tracking Technologies: We use cookies, pixels, and similar technologies to enhance your browsing experience, analyze site traffic, and personalize content.

3. How We Use Your Information

We use the collected data for the following purposes:

  • To operate, maintain, and improve our website and services.

  • To respond to inquiries, provide customer support, and fulfill requests.

  • To send newsletters, updates, or promotional materials (if you have opted in).

  • To monitor website usage and detect, prevent, and address technical issues or fraudulent activity.

  • To comply with legal obligations or enforce our Terms of Service.

4. How We Share Your Information

We do not sell your personal data. However, we may share your information with:

  • Service Providers: Third-party vendors who help us operate the website (e.g., hosting, analytics, email marketing).

  • Legal Requirements: If required by law, court order, or government regulation.

  • Business Transfers: In connection with a merger, sale, or transfer of assets, your data may be included as part of that transaction.

  • Google Analytics: We may share certain information with Google Analytics for the purpose of tracking and analyzing the use of the Services. Google Analytics is a web analytics service provided by Google LLC (“Google”) that collects, monitors, and reports on website traffic and user interactions. Information collected by Google Analytics may also be combined with other data held by Google and used in accordance with Google’s own policies, including to contextualize and personalize advertisements within Google’s advertising network.

    You may opt out of the collection and processing of your data by Google Analytics by installing the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on, which prevents the Google Analytics JavaScript components (ga.js, analytics.js, and dc.js) from transmitting information regarding your activity on the Services.

    For further details regarding Google’s data collection and processing practices, please review the Google Privacy Policy available at: https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en.

5. Your Privacy Rights

Depending on your location, you may have the right to:

  • Access, update, or delete your personal data.

  • Opt-out of marketing communications at any time.

  • Restrict or object to certain data processing activities.

  • Request a copy of the data we hold about you.

To exercise these rights, please contact us at: https://theprotectionguru.com/contact-us/

6. Legal Bases for Processing Personal Information

We process your personal information only where we have a valid legal basis under applicable law, including:

  • Consent – when you have given explicit or implied permission (which you may withdraw at any time).
  • Contract – when necessary to perform or enter into an agreement with you.
  • Legal Obligation – when required to comply with applicable laws, regulations, or legal processes.
  • Legitimate Interests – when processing is reasonably necessary for our lawful business purposes and does not override your rights.
  • Vital Interests – when necessary to protect your safety or that of others.

EU/UK Residents (GDPR/UK GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA): Processing is based on consent, contract performance, legal obligations, legitimate interests, or vital interests, as detailed above.

Canada Residents: Processing is based on express or implied consent, or as otherwise permitted by law, including fraud prevention, investigations, business transactions, compliance with legal orders, insurance claims, protection of vulnerable individuals, journalistic/artistic purposes, or where information is publicly available or de-identified for research.

7. Data Security

We implement reasonable technical and organizational measures to protect your information from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the internet is completely secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

8. Data Retention

We retain your personal information only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this policy or as required by law.

9. Third-Party Links

Our website may contain links to third-party sites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of those websites. We encourage you to review their privacy policies.

10. Minor’s Privacy

Our services are not directed to children under the age of 18 (or the minimum age in your jurisdiction). We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If we learn that we have inadvertently collected such data, we will delete it promptly.

11. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. The updated version will be posted on this page with a revised “Effective Date.” Continued use of our website means you accept the updated policy.

12. Contact Us

If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or how we handle your data, you may contact us at:

🌐 theprotectionguru.com/contact
